meanings.definition: To free or relieve from something unwanted or burdensome.
meanings.sent1: She helped me rid my room of old toys.
meanings.sent2: I need to rid my mind of negative thoughts.
meanings.sent3: He tried to rid the house of spiders by singing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped rid the streets of dust and dirt.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion rid the princess of her curse.

meanings.sent1: The new vacuum cleaner can rid the carpet of pet hair easily.
meanings.sent2: I want to rid my closet of clothes I no longer wear.
meanings.sent3: The superhero used his powers to rid the city of crime.
meanings.sent4: The fresh air helped rid my mind of stress.
meanings.sent5: The broom can rid the porch of fallen leaves.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something free of something unwanted.
meanings.sent1: She tried to rid her dog of fleas with a special shampoo.
meanings.sent2: I need to rid my computer of viruses.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to rid the soup of excess salt.
meanings.sent4: The wind can rid the garden of pesky insects.
meanings.sent5: The medicine will rid you of that nasty cough.
